content: On August 11, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced the New York Mets in a thrilling game that showcased their rising dominance in the National League. Tom Glavine pitched a stellar game, allowing only one run over eight innings, leading the Braves to a 4-1 victory. This win was a pivotal moment in the Braves' season as they began to solidify their reputation as contenders, ultimately leading to their remarkable 1991 World Series run.
